Now that the orientation week has passed, it's time to get started on one's studies - be sure to check out the courses introduced in this mail. Furthermore, if you're interested in choir singing, make sure to check out the upcoming auditions for various choirs.

A lot is happening during this October and November! You can, for example, sign up for the guild's Game Jam, go to excursions or celebrate teekkarius at the 152. Teekkari tradition ball. Additionally, Tempaus has a head start event coming up, as well as an ongoing blood donation campaign.

Welcome to reading the last weekly mail of the year! Big thanks to all who've been reading these mails; I for sure have had a really fun year as the guild's head of communications <3 Weekly mails will return in January, and Julia Raiko will start in the role.

Welcome to the first weekly newsletter of 2025!

At the turn of the year, the role of Head of Communications transferred from Roosa Rauhala to me, so I'll briefly introduce myself. My name is Julia Raiko, and I‚Äôm a third-year computer science student. I‚Äôve been involved in the guild as an ISO and in various committee roles, and now I‚Äôm looking forward to the upcoming year as Head of Communications!

This week, the guild will host its first events of the year: the Wolt excursion and the Murskaveljekset tournament, both of which are still open for registration. In addition, you can suggest a receiver of a badge of merit. There are also interesting hobby opportunities available from organizations outside of Aalto.
Wishing everyone a great start to the spring semester!

The calendar for this and the coming weeks is full of exciting events! There's still time to join activities like bouncing around at Esport Extreme activity park or Teekkarispeksi joint-leave. Several gaming events and sitsis are also being organized in the upcoming weeks. Master's students can enroll in a new fifth-period course on AI agents. In May, AYY will celebrate its 15th anniversary, and the registration for the annual ball, open to everyone, will open in mid-April. This week, there will be a Wappu doughnut night, where you can bake doughnuts and enjoy good games and great company. Before Wappu, you'll also have the chance to try out a new sport at the bouldering event. The signups for the legendary Wappucruise and AATU appro will also begin this week!
Happy Easter and a relaxing spring break to everyone!

The week will be wrapped up by the Aalto Open Air festival event on Saturday. There are also a few spots left for the AATU-appro in Turku. If your fifth study period is looking empty, check out the communication courses open to all Aalto students!
